sen.j: 九州征伐、小田原征伐と歴戦し、天正17年（1589年）に美濃国福束城主となり、2万石を拝領した。
sen.e: Kanetoshi participated in a series of military campaigns which were the Kyushu Campaign resulting in the conquest of Kyushu (which is called 'Kyushu seibatsu' in Japanese) and the Siege of Odawara resulting in the conquest of Odawara (called 'Odawara seibatsu' in Japanese), and became the Lord of Fukutsuka-jo Castle in 1589, with a stipend of 20,000 koku.

sen.j: 慶長5年（1600年）、関ヶ原の戦いにおいて西軍に属し、8月16日の前哨戦で、東軍の市橋長勝、徳永寿昌と戦い、敗れて居城の福束城を放棄して大垣城に逃亡する。
sen.e: During the Battle of Sekigahara in 1600, Kanetoshi sided with the 'western' army, and at a preliminary skirmish on August 16th, Kanetoshi fought a loosing battle against the enemy troops of the 'eastern' army led by Nagakatsu ICHIHASHI and Nagamasa TOKUNAGA, resulting in abandoning his Fukutsuka-jo Castle and taking refuge at Ogaki-jo Castle.
